The website earlier mentioned that it has been dropped to 0.1%. However, after the change was noticed, the website updated the document rectifying the error.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points to end at 54,303, logs worst week in a month
text: The Sensex crashed 1,017 points on Friday to settle at 54,303, while the Nifty closed 276 points lower at 16,201, logging the worst week in a month. The benchmark indices fell as European markets declined ahead of US inflation data. As many as 37 of the Nifty 50 stocks declined on Friday, while 13 of them posted gains.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Uber is recession resistant, doesn't see a need for job cuts: CEO Dara
text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi during an event said that the company is "recession resistant" and doesn't see a need for job cuts amid market volatility and technology companies opting for cost-cutting and slow hiring. Earlier in May, Khosrowshahi told his employees over an email that Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' while announcing a need for job cuts.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to trade below 55,000; Nifty slips below 16,300
text: Sensex fell over 1,000 points to trade at 54,299 and Nifty was lower by 284 points or 1.73% at 16,214.45 during Friday's intraday trade. Shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC), plunged 1.77% to hit an all-time intraday low of ₹709.20. Notably, Kotak Mahindra Bank was the top Nifty loser as the stock dropped 3.44% to ₹1,801.05.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Abu Dhabi's ADIA to buy 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance for ₹2,200 cr
text: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) will invest ₹2,200 crore for a 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance. As of March 31, 2022, IIFL Finance's home loan arm has Assets Under Management of ₹23,617 crore. The deal will reportedly value the lender at ₹11,000 crore. It will mark one of the biggest investments in the affordable housing segment in India.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Take the extra mile: Wizz Air CEO asks staff to work through fatigue
text: European airline Wizz Air's CEO József Váradi is facing criticism after he told his staff that too many crew members were refusing to fly when fatigued. He said, "We're all fatigued but sometimes it is required to take the extra mile...We cannot run this business when every fifth person of a base reports sickness because the person is fatigued."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's sovereign rating outlook revised to Stable from Negative by Fitch
text: Fitch Ratings has revised the outlook on India's sovereign rating to Stable from Negative and has affirmed the rating at 'BBB-'. "The Outlook revision reflects our view that downside risks to medium-term growth have diminished due to India's rapid economic recovery,” it said. It cut economic growth forecast to 7.8% for FY23 from the 8.5% prediction it made in March.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: TikTok senior executive 'steps back' after saying 'firms shouldn't offer maternity leave'
text: A senior executive at TikTok has "stepped back" and said he "will take some time off" from his role after he told his staff in London that as a "capitalist", he didn't believe companies should offer paid maternity leave. Meanwhile, a TikTok spokesperson said, "We're investigating alleged statements...to determine whether there has been a breach of company policies."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: LIC share price touches all-time low of ₹720; down 24% from IPO price
text: Shares of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) touched their all-time low price of ₹720.10 on Thursday, falling 24.12% from its IPO issue price of ₹949. LIC's share price settled 2.23% lower on Thursday at ₹721.60. Due to the fall in share price, LIC's market capitalisation has fallen to ₹4.57 lakh crore against over ₹6 lakh crore at the issue price.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Which are the top 10 economies for FDIs as per UN?
text: India is among the top 10 economies for FDI inflows in 2021, ranking 7th after the US, China, Hong Kong, Singapore, Canada and Brazil, according to United Nations Conference on Trade and Development's latest World Investment Report. South Africa, Russia and Mexico rounded up the top 10 economies for FDI inflows in 2021.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Beauty retailer Purplle becomes India's newest unicorn after raising $33mn funding
text: Sequoia Capital-backed online beauty products marketplace Purplle has joined the unicorn club after the Mumbai-based company raised $33 million as part of its Series E funding round led by South Korea's Paramark Ventures. Existing investors Premji Invest, Blume Ventures, and Kedaara Capital also participated in the round. The company has raised $215 million to date, including this round.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Facebook begins trading as Meta on Nasdaq; changes stock ticker symbol
text: After trading on Nasdaq as Facebook for a decade, the company began trading under the name 'Meta' on Thursday. This also led to a change in its stock ticker symbol to Meta, replacing the company's ticker symbol 'FB', which it had been using since its IPO in 2012. In October 2021, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the company's name change.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: LIC stock hits all-time low, wipes off ₹1.5 lakh cr investor wealth since listing
text: LIC stock hit record lows of ₹708.05 on NSE and ₹708.80 on BSE on Friday, down over 25% from its issue price of ₹949. LIC's market capitalisation fell to ₹4.49 lakh crore at the end of trade on Friday from ₹6 lakh crore, BSE data showed. LIC shareholders lost ₹1.51 lakh crore in less than a month of its listing.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Fintech market likely to reach $150 bn valuation by 2025: MoS Finance
text: Minister of State (MoS) for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Wednesday said the growth in Indian fintech startups has been exponential and the market is expected to reach a valuation of $150 billion by 2025. India's fintech adoption rate is at 87% as against the global average of 64%, Chaudhary noted. Fintech is one of India's immensely growing sectors, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SEBI lets off Tata Motors for concealing facts in 18-year-old case
text: SEBI has let off Tata Motors Limited (TML) with a warning to be "more careful" in its future dealings in the securities market. SEBI said adverse orders passed now may not practically serve any purpose for events accrued over 18 years ago. It was alleged that Tata Finance, which was merged with TML, concealed true and correct facts from investors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: HDFC hikes retail prime lending rate on housing loans by 50 bps
text: HDFC on Thursday hiked its retail prime lending rate, on which its adjustable-rate home loans are benchmarked, by 50 basis points with effect from June 10. This is the fourth time that HDFC has raised home loan rates in June, taking the month's total hike to 90 basis points. Kotak Mahindra Bank and ICICI Bank also hiked interest rates recently.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Reliance, Apollo make $6.3 bn joint bid for drugstore chain Boots: Report
text: A consortium of Reliance Industries Limited and Apollo Global Management has made a binding offer for Walgreen Boots Alliance's international arm, Bloomberg reported. The joint proposal values the drugstore chain at over $6.3 billion. Walgreens has been seeking a valuation of about $8.8 billion for Boots, which runs a network of over 2,200 stores across the UK.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI hikes repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%, 2nd hike in 2 months
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the central bank has raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%. The announcement was made following a three-day meet of the Monetary Policy Committee. The hike comes after the central bank announced a 40 bps increase in repo rate in an off-cycle policy move in May.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Musk warns Twitter he'll terminate $44 bn deal if fake accounts data not given
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has written a letter to Twitter saying the company is "actively resisting and thwarting" his right to information about fake accounts on the platform. This is a "clear material breach" of Twitter's obligations under the $44 billion merger deal, he wrote. Musk further said he reserves all rights to terminate the deal to acquire Twitter.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I-T portal not hacked, Infosys fixing issue: Govt as site suffers glitch on anniversary
text: The government said that there was no data breach on the Income Tax e-filing portal after its search option malfunctioned on the first anniversary of its launch. "Infosys has been directed to look into it and...has confirmed that they are resolving the issue on priority," said the Income Tax Department on Twitter.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Who are UP-born billionaire Gupta brothers arrested in UAE on corruption charges?
text: Rajesh Gupta and Atul Gupta of the wealthy Gupta family were arrested in Dubai on Tuesday for corruption in South Africa. The UP-born brothers had multiple businesses in South Africa including IT, media, mining etc. They enjoyed close ties with former South African President Jacob Zuma and allegedly benefited financially from them. They're also accused of fraud and money laundering.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Credit cards can now be linked to UPI, starting with RuPay: RBI
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday announced that credit cards will now be allowed to be linked with the UPI accounts. The implementation will begin with the indigenous RuPay credit cards, followed by other card networks such as Visa and Mastercard. Until now, customers could only link their debit cards to UPI.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Pitt accuses Jolie of inflicting harm on him by selling her stake in $28 mn wine firm
text: Brad Pitt has accused his ex-wife Angelina Jolie of trying to intentionally inflict harm on him by damaging the reputation of their jointly owned wine business, Château Miraval which they bought for $28.4 million in 2008. Pitt alleged that Jolie sold her stake to a company while having agreed to never sell their respective stakes without each other's consent.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Game changer: Paytm CEO on RBI move to allow linking credit cards to UPI
text: Reacting to RBI's announcement that credit cards will be allowed to be linked with UPI, Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, "This is a game changer move by RBI." He added, "Also the beginning of MDR/ Interchange of card networks starting to apply on mobile payments." Notably, linking of credit cards with UPI will begin with RuPay cards.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Central Bank Digital Currency will be introduced this fiscal: RBI
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Wednesday said the Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC), also known as digital rupee, will be introduced in fiscal year 2022-23. Process of introduction of CBDC will be gradual to avoid any impact on the financial and banking system, Sankar added. Introduction of CBDC was announced in Union Budget 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Zomato likely to sign Blinkit's acquisition deal on June 17: Reports
text: The Zomato board is likely to meet on June 17 to sign off Blinkit's acquisition, as per reports. While the deal earlier valued Blinkit at $700 million, the final value is expected to be lower as this would involve a stock swap in a 1:10 ratio, where Zomato would get 10 shares of Blinkit for every one of its shares.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: List of achievements of PM Modi-led govt in 8 years shared by Harsh Goenka
text: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka shared a list of achievements of PM Narendra Modi-led government in eight years. The list showed how India climbed up in ranking in various fields such as automobile production, steel production, mobile phone production, and global innovation index. Goenka mentioned the source of the data as Bloomberg, MSCI, IMF and Kotak MF.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Railways doubles ticket booking limit on IRCTC, users can book up to 24 tickets per month
text: Indian Railways has doubled online ticket booking limit through IRCTC website and app. An Aadhaar-linked user ID can now book up to 24 tickets in a month instead of 12, provided that one of the passengers should be verifiable through Aadhaar. A user ID which is not linked with Aadhaar can book up to 12 tickets in a month.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India in talks to increase discounted Russian oil imports from Rosneft: Report
text: India is in talks to increase its Russian oil imports with state-owned Rosneft PJSC amid Western sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine war, as per a report. It added that work is on to finalise a six-month supply contract for discounted Russian crude oil to India and that details on volumes and pricing are still being negotiated.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Indian-origin Gupta brothers arrested in UAE over corruption charges
text: The South African government on Monday said two Indian-origin businessmen have been arrested in the UAE while accusing them of profiting from their close links with former President Jacob Zuma and exerting unfair influence. The brothers, Atul and Rajesh Gupta, have denied any wrongdoing. Meanwhile, South African officials said that their extradition talks are taking place with the UAE.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India could be $20 trillion economy by 2040, says Chief Economic Advisor
text: If the dollar GDP doubles every seven years, India will be at $20 trillion GDP by 2040 with per capita income close to $15,000, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said. "India is forecasted by IMF to cross $5 trillion by 2026-27," he stated. "Indian economy is...[in] much better place than many others in the world to face...challenges," Nageswaran added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Was born with a crooked neck, people called me ugly: Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta
text: Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta spoke to 'Humans of Bombay' about her life before becoming one of the youngest CEOs in India at the age of 33. "I was born with a crooked neck…people always told me how ugly I looked," she said. She added that at the age of 22, she had suicidal thoughts after facing multiple job rejections.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Policybazaar-owner PB Fintech shares crash over 15% on CEO's stake sale plan
text: Shares of PB Fintech, which owns Policybazaar, crashed over 15% in Tuesday’s intraday trade after its CEO Yashish Dahiya proposed to sell around 37 lakh shares through the open market. The shares hit an intraday low of ₹557 on the BSE, 15.4% down from its previous close, while on NSE it touched ₹556, 15.6% down from its previous close.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: ED files 1st charge sheet against Choksi's wife, calls her 'ultimate beneficiary'
text: The Enforcement Directorate has filed its first charge sheet against fugitive Mehul Choksi's wife Priti Choksi in the ₹13,000 crore PNB fraud case, stating that she was "hand in glove with her husband" and was the "ultimate beneficial owner". Called "abettor of the crime", the fresh money laundering charges against Priti will allow agencies to pursue her extradition from Antigua.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: HDFC Bank hikes lending rate by 35 bps across all tenors from today, EMIs to go up
text: HDFC Bank has hiked its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 35 basis points across all tenors, effective June 7. As a result of the hike, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more expensive. The bank has hiked its MCLR by 60 basis points since the RBI hiked the repo rate by 40 basis points in May.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's FY23 economic growth forecast cut to 7.5% by World Bank
text: The World Bank on Tuesday cut India's FY23 economic growth forecast to 7.5% from 8% estimated earlier in April. It cut the forecast due to "headwinds from rising inflation, supply chain disruptions, and geopolitical tensions offsetting buoyancy in the recovery of services consumption from the pandemic". World Bank had trimmed the projection for India from 8.7% to 8% in April.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: SEBI may use US casinos-like AI tech against insider trading: Report
text: SEBI is in talks with a US-based AI firm to develop Vegas casinos-like AI tech to catch insider trading, Economic Times reported citing sources. If the deal goes through, the company will customise the software according to the requirements of SEBI. The company has given a live demonstration to SEBI as to how the software will work.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Debt Recovery Tribunal can't restrain person from flying abroad: HC
text: Debt Recovery Tribunal (DRT) does not have the power to restrain a person from travelling abroad, the Bombay High Court ruled on Tuesday. DRT, however, has the power to prevent abuse of its process or secure ends of its justice, the HC added. The bench was hearing a plea by a 34-year-old businessman restrained by the DRT from flying abroad.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 2.9%, warns of stagflation
text: World Bank on Tuesday cut its global growth forecast for 2022 by 1.2 percentage points to 2.9% and warned of stagflation. It said the Russia-Ukraine war has compounded damage from COVID-19 pandemic, with many countries likely to face recession. World Bank President David Malpass said such a period of weak growth and high inflation was last seen in the 1970s.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI raises inflation projection for FY23 from 5.7% to 6.7%
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Russia-Ukraine war "has led to globalisation of inflation" and announced RBI's decision to raise FY23 inflation projection from 5.7% to 6.7%. "Inflationary pressures have become broad-based and remain largely driven by adverse supply shocks," Das said. RBI's Monetary Policy Committee said inflation is likely to remain above 6% in FY23's first three quarters.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI raises limit for recurring payment e-mandate to ₹15,000
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday raised the limit for e-mandates for recurring payments such as subscriptions, fees and EMIs from ₹5,000 to ₹15,000. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, while announcing the decision, said, "This will further leverage the benefits available under the framework and augment customer convenience." RBI also raised the repo rate by 50 basis points on Wednesday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ED seizes assets of Gupta Builders & Promoters in money laundering case
text: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday said it has seized an Audi car, ₹85 lakh in cash and documents during raids against Chandigarh-based Gupta Builders and Promoters in an alleged money laundering case. The builders are accused of cheating investors of ₹325 crore. ED's probe has found that homebuyers' money was used to purchase various personal assets by the firm's directors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sensex, Nifty fall for fourth straight day as RBI hikes repo rate
text: Indian stock benchmarks Sensex and Nifty fell for the fourth straight day on Wednesday after RBI raised the repo rate by 50 basis points to 4.90%. While Sensex fell 214.85 points to close at 54,892.49, Nifty fell 60.10 points today to close at 16,356.25. Sensex has fallen 926.28 points while Nifty has fallen 271.25 points in last four trading sessions.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No change in existing banknotes: RBI on reports it may use Tagore, Kalam's pics
text: The RBI has denied reports that it is considering changes to the existing currency and banknotes by replacing the face of Mahatma Gandhi with that of others. The RBI on Monday clarified that there will be no change in existing currency and banknotes. Earlier, reports said that RBI is considering using Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam's pictures on banknotes.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sheryl told people she felt burned out & had become a punching bag at Meta: Report
text: Sheryl Sandberg recently stepped down as Meta's COO after 14 years at the company. According to a report, Sheryl had been talking to people about how she "felt burned out" and that she increasingly felt "like a punching bag" for the company's problems. She sees herself as someone who has been targeted, said a person who worked with her.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Have a super bad feeling about economy: World's richest man Elon Musk
text: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk, in an email titled "pause all hiring worldwide" for his employees, reportedly wrote that he has a "super bad feeling" about the economy. He added that Tesla would need to cut about 10% of the salaried staff. After the report about his email emerged, the company's shares fell 9% on Friday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla headcount will increase, salaried to be fairly flat: Musk after job cuts email
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted that the company's total headcount would increase over the next 12 months but the salaried staff "should be fairly flat". Musk was replying to a Twitter user who said Tesla's headcount would increase over the next year. His tweet comes days after he reportedly emailed his staff about 10% job cuts at Tesla.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I give a lot more money to climate change than Musk or anyone else: Gates
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in an interview said that he gives "a lot more money" to climate change than the world's richest person Elon Musk "or anyone else". Musk recently claimed that Gates has a "multi-billion dollar short position" against Tesla. Reacting to the claim, Gates said, "Somebody shorting...(Tesla) stock doesn't slow him down or hurt him in any way."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Have to love Trump's branding: Ashneer on 'Biden did that' sticker at US petrol pump
text: BharatPe's former Managing Director Ashneer Grover took to Twitter to share a picture of 'Biden did that' sticker featuring former US President Donald Trump at a petrol pump in the US. Grover wrote, "Politics is same everywhere...here in US Trump is savvy sticking these things at petrol pumps." He further said, "Have to love Trump's branding."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: His talks will be taught in classes: Paytm CEO on Jaishankar's remark on Europe
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has praised External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar, after the latter said, "Europe has to grow out of the mindset that Europe's problems are the world's problems but the world's problems are not Europe's problems." Sharing a video of Jaishankar's response, Sharma wrote, "I am sure his conversations one day will be taught in classrooms."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Mercedes to recall 1 million older cars worldwide over possible faulty brakes
text: Mercedes-Benz is recalling nearly a million older cars worldwide due to a possible problem with the braking system, said the company on Saturday. It added that models of the ML, GL (BR 164) and R-Class (BR 251) series produced between 2004 and 2015 will be affected. As per the federal transport authority, worldwide 9,93,407 vehicles were being recalled.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: PhonePe is a made in India company, we will list in India: CEO
text: PhonePe Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam told CNN News-18 that it is moving its holding company from Singapore to India and plans to launch an IPO in India. "We are a made in India company. Every office, data centre, and employee of ours is here. There's no reason why we shouldn't contribute to wealth creation in this market," Nigam said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Only Indian money funds war? EAM on criticism over India buying Russian oil
text: EAM S Jaishankar rejected criticism from the West that India's purchase of Russian oil is helping fund the Ukraine war. Jaishankar said, "If India buying Russian oil is funding the war...Tell me...buying Russian gas isn't funding the war? It's only Indian money and Russian oil coming to India funding the war and not Russia's gas coming to Europe not funding?"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Look into this: FM to LIC as 17-yr-old orphan gets notices to repay ₹29 lakh loan
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked LIC to look into the matter of a 17-year-old orphan girl receiving legal notices from the state-run insurer to repay ₹29 lakh on a home loan taken by her father. Vanisha lost both her parents to COVID-19 during the second wave. LIC has blocked her father's savings as Vanisha is a minor, TOI reported.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: PM launches new series of coins, says 'it will remind people of goal of amrit kal'
text: PM Narendra Modi has released a special series of ₹1, ₹2, ₹5, ₹10 and ₹20 coins, featuring the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' design. The "visually impaired friendly" coins will be a part of the circulation, the government said. PM Modi said the coins will "remind people of the goal of amrit kal" and motivate them to work towards India's development.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI may use pics of Rabindranath Tagore, APJ Abdul Kalam on banknotes: Report
text: In a first, the Finance Ministry and the RBI are considering using watermark figures of Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam on a new series of banknotes, as per a report. It added that two separate sets of Gandhi, Tagore and Kalam watermarks have been sent to IIT-Delhi Emeritus Professor Dilip T Shahani before a final presentation to the Centre.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: We never intended to promote any sort of culture: Layer'r Shot after criticism of ads
text: Layer'r Shot has apologised after facing criticism over its advertisements, which were accused of promoting rape culture. "We never intended to hurt anyone’s sentiments...or outrage any woman’s modesty, or promote any sort of culture, as wrongly perceived by some," it said. "We...apologise for...advertisements that consequentially caused rage amongst individuals and several communities."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Beer prices surge to £8 per pint for the first time ever in London
text: The price of a pint of beer has reached £8 (about ₹775) for the first time ever in London amid rising inflation, according to research from industry tracker CGA. Meanwhile, the average price of a pint of beer in UK has increased to £3.95. Beer prices in UK have risen over 70% since the financial crisis of 2008, CGA said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Abbott resumes production at Michigan plant amid shortage of baby formula in US
text: Abbott is restarting baby formula production at its Michigan plant after its shutdown led to a shortage of baby food in the US. The Michigan plant, one of America's largest, was closed in February after reports of bacterial contamination found in its formula products. The company said that the facility met initial government sanitary requirements for reopening.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: World's biggest 4-day work week trial with no loss of salary begins in UK
text: The world's biggest trial of four-day work week is set to begin in the UK on Monday, with more than 70 companies and 3,300 employees. The trial will not result in any loss of pay for employees. It is based on the 100:80:100 model, implying that employees will get 100% of pay for 80% of time and maintain 100% productivity.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Lego 'freezes' ops in some Russian stores after supply gets hit due to sanctions
text: Toymaker Lego's Russian reseller has said it is temporarily "freezing" operations at some of its stores in the country after the sanctions imposed on Moscow impacted its supply network. In March, Lego paused shipments to Russia due to disruptions caused by the Ukraine war. The company has 81 stores in Russia, which are operated by Inventive Retail Group.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 'Fat finger' trade causes ₹250 crore loss in India's biggest trading mistake: Report
text: A 'fat finger' trade on the National Stock Exchange's (NSE) derivatives segment on Thursday may have caused a loss of up to ₹250 crore to an unknown brokerage house, PTI reported. This could be the biggest trading mistake in the history of the Indian market. A 'fat finger' error is a human error caused by pressing the wrong key.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: A Manimekhalai appointed as 1st woman MD & CEO of Union Bank of India
text: The Centre has appointed A Manimekhalai as the MD and CEO of Union Bank of India for a period of three years with effect from the date of assumption of office. Notably, Manimekhalai will be the first woman to hold these positions at the bank. She will replace Rajkiran Rai G, who held these positions since 2017.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: LIC share price hits record low, market value falls below ₹5 lakh crore
text: Shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) hit record low on Monday after falling nearly 2%. The state-run insurer's shares fell to an all-time low of ₹782.50 on the NSE and its market capitalisation fell below ₹5 lakh crore. Notably, LIC had become India's fifth-largest company after listing on May 17, with a market value of ₹5.70 lakh crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 4 of top 10 valued firms add ₹2.31 lakh cr in m-cap in past week; RIL lead gainer
text: Four of the top 10 most valued domestic firms together added ₹2,31,320.37 crore in market valuation in the past week. While Reliance Industries contributed the most with a valuation jump of ₹1,38,222.46 crore to ₹18,80,350.47 crore, it was followed by TCS whose valuation zoomed by ₹64,618.85 crore to ₹12,58,274.59 crore. Infosys and ICICI Bank were the other gainers.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: RBI likely to go for another 0.40% rate hike in next policy review meet: Report
text: The RBI is expected to go for another rate hike of 0.40% at the review of the monetary policy next week, as per a report. The RBI panel will reportedly follow it up with a 0.35% hike in rates in the August review or it may opt for a 0.50% hike next week and a 0.25% increase in August.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Banks willing to finance Reliance-Apollo bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
text: Lending banks are reportedly willing to finance a joint bid by Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management in case they acquire UK pharmacy chain Boots. Currently, the drugstore chain is owned by Walgreens Boots Alliance. Walgreens put up Boots for sale in December last year and has been seeking a valuation of about £7 billion for it.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IL&FS creditors to get ₹16,000 crore on pro-rata basis
text: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has approved the interim distribution of ₹16,361 crore to IL&FS creditors at the holding company level. The amount includes ₹11,296 crore in cash and ₹5,065 crore in Infrastructure Investment Trusts. The interim distribution "shall be implemented only after approval by the new board" and "shall take place [on] pro rata basis", NCLAT said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's trade deficit widens to $23.33 bn in May, exports rise 15%
text: India's trade deficit widened to $23.33 billion in May 2022, compared with $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, as imports grew faster than exports. Merchandise exports rose 15.46% to $37.29 billion while imports grew 56.14% to $60.62 billion. While petroleum and crude oil imports rose 91.6% to $18.14 billion, coal imports rose to $5.33 billion in May 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Investment deals worth ₹80,000 crore signed in Uttar Pradesh: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Friday, addressing Uttar Pradesh Investors Summit, said investment deals worth ₹80,000 crore have been signed across sectors in the state, which will help create thousands of employment opportunities. "I congratulate the youth of UP...as they'll benefit most from this," he added. "This is the time to set new goals for next 25 years," the PM said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Mukesh Ambani replaces Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest man
text: Reliance Industries' Mukesh Ambani has replaced Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest man. According to  Bloomberg Billionaires Index, as of June 3, the total net worth of Mukesh Ambani is $99.7 billion and the total net worth of Gautam Adani is $98.7 billion. While Ambani now stands at the eighth position worldwide, Adani is placed in the ninth place.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Mukesh Ambani becomes 8th richest?
text: Elon Musk is the richest person worldwide with a net worth of $227 billion on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index. He's followed by Jeff Bezos($149 billion), Bernard Arnault ($138 billion), Bill Gates ($124 billion), Warren Buffett ($114 billion), Larry Page ($106 billion), Sergey Brin ($102 billion), Mukesh Ambani ($99.7 billion), Gautam Adani ($98.7 billion) and Steve Ballmer ($96.8 billion).
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Elon wanted to be the wealthiest man even as a pre-schooler: Musk's father
text: Elon Musk's father Errol Musk told AFP that even as a pre-schooler, the Tesla CEO had set his sights on becoming the wealthiest man alive. Recalling an incident when Elon announced his plans to become a millionaire, Errol said an adult told him that he would be disappointed. "Elon responded, 'Well, I think you're stupid'. That's typically Elon," said Errol.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon consumer CEO Dave Clark resigns after 23 years at the company
text: Amazon's CEO of Worldwide Consumer Business, Dave Clark, on Friday announced that he is resigning from his position after 23 years at the company. "I've had an incredible time at Amazon but it's time for me to build again," he tweeted. Clark had joined Amazon just a day after graduating from his MBA programme, Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Everyone eats same food, uses same restrooms: Musk on Tesla's work culture
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while responding to a Twitter user regarding Tesla's work environment, said, "Everyone eats the same food, uses the same restrooms, etc- no executive chef or other ivory tower stuff. There shouldn't be this workers vs management two-class system. Everyone is a worker." The Twitter user had remarked that there is "no blue/white distinction" at Tesla.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla needs to cut staff by 10%: Elon Musk as he pauses all hiring
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the company needs to cut staff by around 10% as he has a "super bad feeling" about the economy, according to an internal email. The email, titled "pause all hiring worldwide", was sent to Tesla executives on Thursday. Earlier, Musk asked Tesla employees to return to the office or leave the company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Lots of luck on trip to the Moon: Biden as Musk raises concerns about economy
text: US President Joe Biden, when asked about Tesla CEO Elon Musk's comment about having a "super bad feeling" about the economy, said, "Lots of luck on his trip to the Moon." Biden also commented on Musk's plans to cut about 10% of Tesla's workforce and said, "While Elon Musk is talking about that, Ford is increasing their investment overwhelmingly."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Regulatory waiting period for Musk's $44 billion buyout deal is over: Twitter
text: Twitter on Friday said that the waiting period under the HSR Act for billionaire Elon Musk's $44-billion acquisition deal has expired. The deal's completion is now subject to remaining customary closing conditions, which include approval by Twitter stockholders and receipt of required regulatory approvals, Twitter said. The deal has cleared an antitrust review by the Federal Trade Commission.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Coinbase extends hiring freeze, revokes some accepted job offers
text: Coinbase has extended its hiring freeze for "as long as the macro-economic factors remain in place". They also revoked accepted offers from some candidates who haven't joined it yet. "We always knew cryptocurrency would be volatile, but that volatility alongside larger economic factors may test the company, and us personally, in new ways," said LJ Brock, Coinbase's Chief People Officer.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Edtech unicorn Eruditus fires 80 employees as part of business restructuring
text: Mumbai-based edtech startup Eruditus has fired some of its employees from the marketing and talent acquisition teams as part of its business restructuring and to focus on profitability. While the company reportedly fired 80 employees, Co-founder Ashwin Damera said 40 of them resigned voluntarily. Eruditus turned unicorn in 2021 when it raised $650 million at a valuation of $3.2 billion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Not good for entrepreneurs to treat IPOs as 'surrogate' for financing: Narayana Murthy
text: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy on Friday remarked that IPOs are being treated as a "surrogate" for new rounds of financing by entrepreneurs and that this isn't a good thing. He said, "IPO comes with tremendous responsibility...so many people with very little money...put faith in us and put in their meagre disposable income, it is important to give them a...return."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Today's entrepreneurs are much smarter than I was: Narayana Murthy
text: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy while speaking at an event organised for startups, said, "I personally think that today's entrepreneurs are much smarter than I was." He added that there are three ingredients for success as an entrepreneur, namely, access to customer or market access, access to talent, and availability of venture capital funds.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: SBI assures financial support to family of bank manager killed in J&K
text: SBI on Thursday assured financial support to the family of the 26-year-old bank manager who was shot dead by terrorists inside Ellaquai Dehati Bank in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district. EDB is a Srinagar-headquartered regional rural bank sponsored by SBI. Kumar was one of many such bankers working in Kashmir Valley ensuring uninterrupted banking services to the public, SBI added.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt approves 8.1% interest rate on EPF deposits for FY22, lowest in 4 decades
text: The central government has approved an interest rate of 8.1% on employee provident fund (EPF) deposits for 2021-22, news agency PTI reported citing an office order from the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). In March, the EPFO had lowered the rate to 8.1% from 8.5% in the previous year, marking the lowest EPF interest rate in more than 40 years.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: We're investing ₹70,000 crore in Uttar Pradesh: Billionaire Gautam Adani
text: Billionaire industrialist Gautam Adani on Friday said that the Adani Group is investing ₹70,000 crore in Uttar Pradesh. Adani further said that ₹24,000 crore will be invested in developing UP's road and transport infrastructure while another ₹35,000 crore will be invested in the state's multimodal logistics and defence sectors. "We anticipate this investment creating over 30,000 jobs," said Adani.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Import of Russian crude oil is not an India-related issue at all: MEA
text: MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday spoke about India's approach to Russian oil imports. "We've consistently maintained that our approach is guided by our energy security requirements...Many regions and countries have taken policy decisions recently with a similar perspective...This is not an India-related issue at all." He was answering a query on the increase in Russian oil imports.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tata Projects to build Noida International Airport in UP's Jewar
text: Tata Group's infrastructure and construction arm, Tata Projects, has been selected to undertake the engineering, procurement and construction of the upcoming Noida International Airport in Uttar Pradesh's Jewar. "Tata Projects will work closely with Yamuna International Airport Private Limited (YIAPL) to deliver India's most advanced and environment-friendly airport on time," CEO Vinayak Pai said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Many countries send back Indian tea over high pesticide content
text: Both international and domestic buyers have rejected a series of tea consignments due to presence of pesticides and chemicals beyond permissible limits, Indian Tea Exporters Association Chairman Anshuman Kanoria said. Kanoria added many countries are following strict entry regulations for tea. Most of the countries follow variations of EU standards, which are more stringent than FSSAI rules.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Marriott hotel chain to leave Russia after 25 years amid Western sanctions
text: The Marriott hotel chain has announced that it is suspending its operations in Russia after more than 25 years. The company said that the Western sanctions made it "impossible" for it to continue operations in the Russian market. In March, the company paused investment in Russia and closed its Moscow office following the invasion of Ukraine.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Gold price rises slightly today, silver selling at ₹62,700 per kg
text: Both gold and silver futures have climbed in the domestic market on June 3 after trading on the lower side for three days in a row. On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold futures stand at ₹51,340/10 grams. The previous close was recorded at ₹51,269. Meanwhile, silver is selling at ₹62,700 per kg.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Elon is a very caring person, he wants to save humanity: Musk's father
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's father Errol in an interview spoke about the former's upbringing and their relationship. Errol said, "Elon is a very caring person. He really means it when he says that he wants to save humanity. This is not a slogan or some sort of pitch." Musk and Errol are reportedly estranged and last met six years ago.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who are India's top 10 richest people as Mukesh Ambani tops the list?
text: Mukesh Ambani on Friday became India's richest person with a net worth of $99.7 billion, as per Bloomberg. He's followed by Gautam Adani ($98.7 billion), Azim Premji ($28.7 billion), and Shiv Nadar ($25.9 billion). The list of India's 10 richest people includes Lakshmi Niwas Mittal ($20.1 billion), Radhakishan Damani ($19.6 billion), Uday Kotak ($14.8 billion) and Dilip Sanghvi ($14.5 billion).
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Restaurants free to raise prices but service charge is consumer's choice: Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal while speaking about the issue of service charges by hotels said that it is a "consumer's choice". He added, "Restaurants can charge whatever they want, there's no price control from the government's side...We've...said that restaurants cannot charge service charges on the bill...If...more benefits are to be given to employees, it cannot be forced on customers."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Kiya.ai launches Kiyaverse, India's first banking metaverse
text: Kiya.ai has announced the launch of India's first-ever banking metaverse named Kiyaverse. Kiyaverse hopes to merge use cases of real-world banking with metaverse banking through avatar-based interactions. Kiya.ai MD and CEO Rajesh Mirjankar said the firm's product roadmap includes integration with Central Bank Digital Currency and interoperability with other metaverses to enable open finance.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CBDCs would kill case for private cryptos' existence: RBI Deputy Guv
text: Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) would "actually...kill whatever little case there could be for private cryptocurrencies", said RBI Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Thursday. Sankar also reiterated RBI's view that private cryptocurrencies shouldn't be permitted "just because they're backed by hi-tech". "Any tool that can be used for good can also be put to undesirable uses," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sri Lanka seeks to secure $5 billion to cover import repayments
text: Sri Lanka is seeking to avail around $5 billion in funding to cover repayments of fuel imports and other items bought through credit lines, the Prime Minister's Office said on Thursday. Sri Lanka is seeking another $1 billion to bolster its foreign reserves. The country is also reportedly looking to borrow $3 billion under International Monetary Fund's Extended Fund Facility.
author: Disha Jana
